attributes.action: order the BBC to immediately re-instate Sir Terry Wogan as commentator on their coverage of the Eurovision Song Contest
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Sir Terry Wogan is one of Britain's best loved television and radio personalities. He first commentated on the Eurovision Song Contest for UK television coverage in 1973, then again in 1978 and every year since 1980 (except when hosting the event in 1998).

His dry, sardonic wit has truly become one of if not the most enjoyable aspect of Eurovision for millions of UK viewers.

The proposed replacement, Graham Norton, is funny himself, but it wouldn't be the same without Wogan.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
